author: sky.cactus
content: In (E) the `base_fee * gas_used == account_balance`.  `gas_price * gas_used > account_balance` and `base_fee * gas_limit > account_balance`.

author: sky.cactus
content: I am pretty sure that (E) will fail, but I wanted to make sure.

author: pietjepuk
content: From what I can tell based on EIP-1559 (`assert balance >= max_fee_per_gas * gas_limit`), only A is valid. Why would you think it'd fail, or put differently, why would `naive_gas_price * gas_limit > account balance` for A?

author: sky.cactus
content: I included A just to make sure no one was requiring `base_fee + priority_fee > account_balance` or something.  I don't expect that one to fail.
